content.question: Which of the following rhythmic patterns indicates a compound division of the beat?

choices.label: One measure on a single line staff. Three groups of two eighth notes beamed together.
One measure on a single line staff. Two groups of three eighth notes beamed together.
One measure on a single line staff. Four groups of a dotted eighth beamed to a sixteenth note.
One measure on a single line staff. Three groups of four sixteenth notes beamed together.

content.answer: One measure on a single line staff. Two groups of three eighth notes beamed together.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in notated music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
